column5: I've always heard that they aren't terribly good to eat. Is it a matter of the species, or just the large size that most anglers are after?

Mr_Chris:Lake Trout can be very good eating. Indeed, some fishermen prefer to eat Lake Trout rather than Walleye. Whether Lake Trout are good eating or not usually depends on the lake from which they are caught. My own experience is that if the flesh has a pink/orange colour rather than a white colour, the Lake Trout will taste great. Even so, I wouldn't contemplate harvesting a Lake Trout over 5 pounds for eating. Jay
